name.baseName: Municial sludge treatment and disposal;dry sludge;mono-incineration
市政污泥处理与处置;干污泥;单一焚烧

dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: The main data sources used in our study are as follows: 1) Energy consumption and material inputs are obtained from investigations in Tai Lake Watershed; 2) The energy use emission factor is obtained from our own calculation, IPCC, and the literature.3) The fugitive emissions during landfilling, incineration, and composting are mainly determined by the model given in the other study as well as by the IPCC factors (2006), except for the CH4 emission in landfilling, which is obtained from study.4) Data from theoretical calculations (see Incineration section).
本文研究的主要数据来源如下:1)能源消耗和物质投入来源于对太湖流域的调查;2)能源利用排放因子来源于我们自己的计算、IPCC和文献。3)填埋过程中的CH4排放由文献获得，填埋、焚烧和堆肥过程中的无组织排放主要由文献研究中给出的模型和IPCC因子(2006)决定。4)理论计算数据(焚烧部分)。

quantitativeReference.functionalUnitOrOther: The functional unit used for GHGs in this LCA is one dry ton (DT) of sludge.

technology.technologyDescriptionAndIncludedProcesse: The kiln temperature is assumed to be 1000 °C during combustion in S2, S3, and S4 and is 1400 °C in S5. Kiln efficiency is assumed to be 75%.
假定S2、S3和S4燃烧时的窑温为1000°C, S5燃烧时的窑温为1400°C。窑炉效率假定为75%。
technology.technologicalApplicability: This municipal sludge treatment and disposal data set is applicable to the mono-incineration process of dry sludge within the Tai Lake Watershed area. It is intended for use in scenarios where environmental impacts, specifically greenhouse gas emissions, of sludge treatment processes are evaluated. This data can be particularly relevant for infrastructure planning, waste management policy development, and assessment of carbon footprint in waste treatment facilities.
本市政污泥处理与处置数据集适用于太湖流域内干污泥的单一焚烧过程。它旨在用于评估污泥处理过程中的环境影响，尤其是温室气体排放。这些数据对于基础设施规划、废物管理政策制定以及废物处理设施的碳足迹评估尤为相关。

referenceToDataSource.common:shortDescription: Liu, B., Wei, Q., Zhang, B. & Bi, J. Life cycle GHG emissions of sewage sludge treatment and disposal options in Tai Lake Watershed, China. Science of The Total Environment 447, 361–369 (2013).
Liu, B., Wei, Q., Zhang, B. & Bi, J. Life cycle GHG emissions of sewage sludge treatment and disposal options in Tai Lake Watershed, China. Science of The Total Environment 447, 361–369 (2013).

dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.useAdviceForDataSet: When using this data set for Life Cycle Assessment, carefully consider the scope and geographical relevance of your assessment. Include this data as part of the inventory analysis phase when evaluating the environmental impact of sludge treatment processes in the Tai Lake watershed area. Ensure that the functional unit of the study is consistent with the data set - one dry ton of sludge. Adaptations may be necessary if the waste characteristics or regulatory conditions differ from those in the Tai Lake area.
在使用本数据集进行生命周期评估时，需要仔细考虑您评估的范围和地理相关性。在评估太湖流域污泥处理过程的环境影响时，将此数据作为清单分析阶段的一部分。确保研究的功能单位与数据集一致——一干吨污泥。如果废物特性或监管条件与太湖地区不同，则可能需要进行调整。

review.common:reviewDetails: Inventory: The internal review was done by several iteration steps concerning raw data validation, raw data documentation, representativity, completeness and consistency of modelling with regard to ISO 14040 and 14044.
清单： 内部审查通过几个迭代步骤完成，涉及原始数据验证、原始数据记录、代表性、完整性、与 ISO 14040 和 14044 有关的建模的一致性。

publicationAndOwnership.common:licenseType: Free of charge for all users and uses
